items.title: ULA aimed to launch up to 10 Vulcan rockets this year—it will fly just once
bullets: • Last year, United Launch Alliance said it would launch as many as 20 missions this year
• Now, it's likely that ULA will close out 2025 with six flights, five with the Atlas V and one with the Vulcan rocket
• The Vulcan rocket’s sole launch this year occurred August 12, when it took off on a mission sponsored by the US Space Force

items.title: Review – Shelby Oaks (2025) hints at something different, but can’t keep its promises
bullets: • Shelby Oaks is a muddled, uneven experiment that never quite figures out what it wants to be
• It swings between cinematic sequences, faux-documentary interviews, and found-footage snippets with little sense of cohesion
• What starts as a promising premise erodes into a greatest-hits compilation of genre clichés

items.title: Texas proposes hiking licensing fees for summer camps by as much as 4,000%
bullets: • Texas officials have proposed hiking annual licensing fees for operators by thousands of dollars and slashing the number of camp representatives on a statewide committee that advises on industry regulations
• The Texas Department of State Health Services, which regulates camps, posted a slate of new rules to the Texas Register on Tuesday

items.title: Guinea-Bissau military takes ‘total control’ amid election chaos
bullets: • Soldiers in Guinea-Bissau have announced they are taking ‘total control’ of the country
• Military officers said they were suspending the electoral process and closing its borders
• It is the latest in a string of coups and attempted coups in the west African country since 1974

items.title: Warner Joins Forces With AI Song Generator, Suno, That It Was Suing
bullets: • Warner Music Group, one of the major labels that sued AI song generator Suno, has signed a licensing deal with the company
• The deal is designed to help Suno move toward a licensed model where users will pay to download songs made on its platform with artificial intelligence
• Suno has also acquired the concert listings Songkick, formerly owned by Warner, as part of the deal

items.title: At long last, the mystery of lightning on Mars is solved
bullets: • Mini-lightning strikes created by whirling dust devils on Mars have been detected accidentally by the Perseverance rover
• The chance discovery is direct evidence of a form of lightning on Mars, researchers say
• Lightning has proven more elusive on our closest planetary neighbors

items.title: Texas hoped $100 million would help more families pay for child care. Here’s why it didn’t.
bullets: • Texas made a major investment in its child care scholarship fund earlier this year
• The money meant to provide more scholarships is covering higher tuition costs
• About 150,000 families received a scholarship last year
• The wait list before the 2025 legislative session was just shy of 95,000

items.title: A West Texas county wants to better prepare for floods. Paying for it will be tricky.
bullets: • Every Texas county has declared a flood disaster at least once
• At least nine, from 1980-2024, have cost the state billions of dollars to remediate the consequences of flooding
• Despite a call from the state’s first-ever flood plan, it can be hard to secure funding ahead of a disaster

items.title: The origins of your dog's unique look may be older than you think
bullets: • By about 10,000 years ago, half of the amount of diversity present in modern dogs was already present in the Neolithic, researchers say
• The study was published in the journal Science
• It's commonly believed that this vast range in physical attributes is a product of the Victorian era

items.title: Fever helps the body fight off viruses: But how does it work?

• Today, researchers understand that fever is part of the immune system's response to a pathogen
• But how they can help kick an infection remains mysterious
